text: Senator Allen Ellender, of Louisiana, sparked off the opposition by telling a television audience it was "current Washington gossip" that Weaver once had Communist affiliations. The Senate Banking Committee, which is headed by another Southern Senator Willis Robertson, of Virginia, met today in closed session to discuss Weaver's appointment. Senator Robertson later disclosed he had sent a letter to Mr. Kennedy saying he had received several complaints about Weaver's loyalty.

The Senate Banking Committee, which is headed by another Southern Senator Willis Robertson, of Virginia, met today in closed session to discuss Weaver's appointment. Senator Robertson later disclosed he had sent a letter to Mr. Kennedy saying he had received several complaints about Weaver's loyalty.
